ygData.subject: RE: My overcrowding solutuion
ygData.msgSnippet: Not totally as it would force someone to hunt down 12 randomly placed named mobs to get a Ykesha quality item rather than just waiting around until one named
ygData.messageBody:
Not totally as it would force someone to hunt down 12 randomly placed named
mobs to get a Ykesha quality item rather than just waiting around until one
named mob spawned somewhere and then going after that. Especially since it
would mean only a ranger or other tracker would be likely to get the special
mob if there was one you could go after with a big payoff.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
Sent: Thursday, January 27, 2000 1:46 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] My overcrowding solutuion


From: <kim@...>

On Thu, 27 Jan 2000, Papa Legba wrote:
> kim@... wrote:
> > You'd still end up with people camping the container and
> > pulling nearby mobs to get the widgets. You haven't really
> > discouraged camping, you've just made it so pulling other
> > nearby mobs (which most campers do anyway) is more important.
>
> Not if the named mobs were all over the place... i wouldnt mind them
> wandering either... Just makes things bit harder to do...

If the named mobs were all over the place, then the container
and widget system is redundant. :)

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
